remarks: For a positive integer and a nonnegative integer both less than a given prime number there is always a second nonnegative integer (less than the given prime number) so that the sum of this second nonnegative integer multiplied with the positive integer and the first nonnegative integer is 0 ( modulo the given prime number).  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 8-Nov-2018.)
